beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Collegiate Gravel Nationals. Turkey, Texas. 62 mi. 100 km, 1.5 thousand m. 80% gravel, 20% dirt. Texas Panhandle. rolling plains, red dirt. Technical rating: 2/5.
beats.text_on_screen: Collegiate Gravel Nationals | Turkey, Texas | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Prestige. 5 out of 5. Bucket list tier. The name speaks for itself. Race Quality. 5 out of 5. Everything about this race is dialed. USA Cycling's championship standards ensure proper execution when they stake their reputation on an event. Field Depth. 5 out of 5. Start line looks like a WorldTour bus exploded. Value. 5 out of 5. Dollar for dollar, one of the best in gravel. Racing for a national championship title that didn't exist before delivers massive opportunity-to-cost ratio for competitive collegiate riders. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Serious exploration vibes. Far from pavement. Racing through Caprock Canyon State Park delivers varied terrain most collegiate riders have never experienced. Community. 4 out of 5. The post-race scene is half the event. The collegiate cycling community will target their first-ever gravel nationals opportunity. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. The medium course runs approximately 50 miles according to Valley of Tears, though some sources list 62 miles. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Enough vertical to remind you gravity exists. 4,921 feet over the course distance provides steady climbing without massive sustained efforts.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Collegiate National Championship. If you're college-aged with decent fitness and want to claim bragging rights as the first-ever winner, this is your shot. The 62-mile mix of gravel roads, rail trail, and singletrack won't destroy you. But March in Texas means unpredictable weather and zero race history to guide your prep. Show up ready for anything because nobody knows what they're doing yet.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Collegiate Gravel Nationals isn't quite right for you. Dirty Kanza offers the real gravel prestige without the growing pains, while Unbound Gravel 100 gives you similar distance with actual race infrastructure. If you want collegiate competition with established traditions, stick to cyclocross nationals where the chaos is intentional.
